macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Indexes Mixed on Friday Amid Light Holiday Trading
items.summary: Major US indexes closed slightly lower on Friday, December 26: S&P 500 down 0.1% to 6,929.94, Dow down 0.1% to 48,710.97, Nasdaq down 0.1% to 23,593.10, Russell 2000 down 0.5% to 2,534.35. For the week, S&P 500 up 1.4%, Dow up 1.2%, Nasdaq up 1.2%; year-to-date gains strong at 17.8%, 14.5%, 22.2% respectively.[1]

items.title: Commodity Prices Show Divergence: Gold and Silver Rise, Oil Falls
items.summary: Gold and silver prices rose, with silver up nearly 8% due to supply constraints, while U.S. crude oil fell 2.8% and Treasury yields held steady amid light trading.[1]

items.title: Target Shares Climb on Activist Investor Stake News
items.summary: Target shares rose following reports of an activist investor taking a stake in the company, standing out amid otherwise subdued market action.[1]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.09% to $2.94T as Bitcoin Falls 1.67% to $87,506
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market cap decreased by 1.09% to $2.94T in the past 24 hours, with Bitcoin down 1.67% to $87,506 and trading volume also declining 1.09% to $269.52B. Bears dominated as 80% of coins lost value, though KAITO surged 23.35% and Prom gained 15.15%.[1]

items.title: BTC and ETH Lead Declines Amid ETF Outflows and Regulatory Shifts
items.summary: Bitcoin dropped 4.4% to $97,474 and Ethereum fell 9.3% to $3,144 over the past 12 hours, driven by ETF outflows, weak risk sentiment, and altcoin losses like ARB (-11.7%) and SOL (-8.7%). Japan plans a dedicated crypto regulatory division in 2026 to enhance oversight and innovation.[2]

items.title: Solana and Hyperliquid Top 2025 Blockchain Revenue Generators
items.summary: Solana generated $1.3 billion in revenue in 2025, leading all blockchains, followed by Hyperliquid at $816 million, surpassing Ethereum's $524 million due to high-throughput execution and usage in DEXs, memecoins, and derivatives trading.[4]

items.title: Crypto Ownership Surges in Europe with Greece and Lithuania Leading Gains
items.summary: Crypto ownership rose across Europe in 2025 despite market volatility, with Greece and Lithuania each up 10 percentage points and other nations like Cyprus and Belgium gaining 7+ points, signaling strengthening retail interest.[7]

items.title: XRP Price Closely Tracks Bitcoin Amid Year-End Bearish Trends
items.summary: XRP has followed Bitcoin's movements, down 9.78% year-to-date as BTC fell 5%, with historical data showing XRP often rallying more explosively during BTC surges, countering claims of decoupling.[6]

items.title: Institutional Moves: Anchorage Transfers 580 BTC, Pantera Deposits ETH
items.summary: Anchorage Digital moved 580.6 BTC ($39.2M) to anonymous addresses, while Pantera Capital-linked wallets deposited 5,264 ETH ($15.39M) to Coinbase Prime, amid broader market declines.[2]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Google Releases Gemini 3 Flash: High-Speed Frontier Model
items.summary: Google launched Gemini 3 Flash, a fast, cost-effective model outperforming Gemini 2.5 Pro on benchmarks like GPQA Diamond (90.4%) and MMMU Pro (81.2%), available globally via API for multimodal tasks and agentic workflows.

items.title: Google T5Gemma 2 Multimodal Encoder-Decoder Announced
items.summary: Google introduced T5Gemma 2, a new multimodal encoder-decoder model, alongside Gemini Enterprise and Mistral OCR 3, as part of recent AI updates highlighted in December 26 weekly recap.

items.title: MIT Develops 'Scientific Sandbox' for Evolving AI Vision Systems
items.summary: MIT researchers created a computational framework where embodied AI agents evolve eyes over generations; navigation tasks yield compound eyes, while object tasks produce camera-type eyes with irises.

items.title: Waymo Tests Gemini AI as In-Car Assistant for Robotaxis
items.summary: Waymo is integrating Google's Gemini chatbot as an in-car AI assistant in its robotaxis, revealed through a 1,200+ line system prompt in the mobile app code.

items.title: 2026 Predicted as Year of Continual Learning in AI
items.summary: AI models have hit PhD-level performance but face catastrophic forgetting; 2026 focus shifts to continual learning, memory compression, and integrating AI into workflows rather than smarter models.

items.title: NIST and MITRE Partner on AI Defense for Critical Infrastructure
items.summary: NIST partners with MITRE's AI Economic Security Center to develop AI tools protecting power plants and hospitals from cyberthreats, emphasizing reliability and dataset protection.

items.title: Wall Street Plans AI-Driven Workforce Cuts
items.summary: Wall Street firms anticipate AI-driven reductions in workforce, coinciding with Hollywood stars forming a creators coalition amid ongoing model releases like GPT-5.2-Codex.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Epic Games Store Reveals Free Game for December 26: We Were Here Together
items.summary: Epic Games Store has officially announced We Were Here Together as its free game giveaway for December 26 as part of its ongoing 2025 holiday promotions.

items.title: Duet Night Abyss: Huaxu Version Launches with New Codes and Events
items.summary: Duet Night Abyss released its Huaxu Version on December 23, introducing new codes like GIFTOFAUGURY and GIFTOFREVERIE, alongside discussions on upcoming wedge events and performance issues.

items.title: Street Fighter 6 December 2025 Patch Notes Released
items.summary: Capcom issued patch notes for Street Fighter 6 in December 2025, including updates to World Tour mode with an expanded map, new masters, and derivative styles, amid community talks on balance changes and esports.

items.title: Street Fighter x CODM Crossover Features Tough Lobbies with Top Players
items.summary: A YouTube stream highlights high-level gameplay in Street Fighter x Call of Duty Mobile crossover, with ongoing CODM live sessions from December 26-27 involving top players and custom rooms.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Samsung Unveils Exynos 2600, World's First 2nm Smartphone Processor
items.summary: Samsung introduced the Exynos 2600, the first 2nm smartphone processor featuring the company's largely in-house developed mobile GPU. This marks a significant advancement in mobile chip technology for mid-range devices.

items.title: TSMC Accelerates Production Timeline for Second Arizona Factory
items.summary: TSMC has sped up the timeline for its second fab in Arizona, enhancing U.S. semiconductor manufacturing capacity amid global supply chain shifts.

items.title: Amazon Confirms Five-Year-Long Russian Cyberattack on AWS Customers
items.summary: Amazon revealed a prolonged Russian cyberattack targeting AWS customers, highlighting ongoing security challenges in cloud infrastructure.

items.title: Microsoft Faces Surge in 365 Account Hacks Linked to China and Russia
items.summary: Microsoft reported a significant increase in Microsoft 365 account hacks, with suspicions pointing to state actors from China and Russia.

items.title: Apple Agrees to App Store Changes in Brazil and Europe, Appeals $115M Italian Fine
items.summary: Apple updated App Store policies to allow third-party stores and payments in Brazil while complying with EU rules, but is appealing a $115 million privacy fine in Italy.

items.title: Amazon Announces Elimination of Over 14,000 Jobs Amid Restructuring
items.summary: Amazon confirmed layoffs affecting more than 14,000 employees as part of corporate restructuring efforts.

items.title: Qualcomm Acquires Alphawave Semi and Ventana Micro, Embraces RISC-V
items.summary: Qualcomm completed acquisitions of connectivity firm Alphawave Semi and RISC-V specialist Ventana Micro, signaling a strategic shift toward open architectures.

items.title: Intel Details 86-Core Granite Rapids Xeon CPUs
items.summary: Intel unveiled specifications for its high-performance 86-core Granite Rapids Xeon processors targeting data center workloads.
